error.signature: error: command 'gcc' failed: No such file or directory. ERROR: Failed building wheel for <package>

verdict.summary: Building a package from source failed because required compiler (gcc/g++) or development libraries are missing. Happens when no prebuilt wheel is available and pip falls back to source distribution.

dead_ends.action: Install the package with --prefer-binary and hope for the best
dead_ends.why_fails: If no binary exists, --prefer-binary still falls back to source and fails the same way
dead_ends.condition: when no binary exists for the platform

dead_ends.action: Set CC=/usr/bin/gcc without actually installing gcc
dead_ends.why_fails: Setting the environment variable does not install the compiler; the file must exist

workarounds.action: Install C compiler and Python development headers
workarounds.how: apt-get install build-essential python3-dev && pip install <package>
Check the package docs for required system libs. Example: apt-get install libxml2-dev libxslt-dev for lxml
workarounds.condition: when package requires specific C libraries

workarounds.action: Use a pre-compiled wheel from piwheels or conda-forge
workarounds.how: pip install --extra-index-url https://www.piwheels.org/simple <package>  # or: conda install <package>
workarounds.condition: when system compilation is not feasible

leads_to.condition: when partial compilation creates broken state

preceded_by.condition: when no binary wheel exists and pip attempts source build

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Src-install-failed is about missing compilers/libraries; build-isolation-failed is about the isolated build environment setup failing before compilation starts
